title: Strictly 'in jeopardy' as second star quits show for first time in 15-year history
text:

Paralympian Will Bayley has quit Strictly Come Dancing, becoming the second celebrity to quit the series this year - a first in the BBC show's 15-year history.

Will suffered a "freak" knee injury in training and was unable to perform on Saturday with professional Janette Manrara.

The pair were given a bye to next week, but his injury has failed to heal and forced him to pull out of the competition.

This means that there will be just three contestants in the final this year rather than the usual four.

(Image: DIGITAL/EROTEME.CO.UK)

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

The gold-medal winning Paralympian said he was devastated to leave the series – which had been one of the highlights of his life.

The table-tennis champ, who suffers with arthrogyposis in all four of his limbs, said: “I’m gutted my Strictly journey has had to come to an end. I’ve loved being part of the show, and am so grateful for the phenomenal support we have received.

"I want to say a special thank you to Janette for believing in me, and giving me the confidence to believe in myself.

"The things we achieved, from our couple’s choice dance, through to the lifts in our salsa, will stay with me forever. I’ve had the time of my life.”

(Image: DIGITAL/EROTEME.CO.UK)

His scans have shown that his injury, which was obtained during rehearsals for the jive, may take up to six months for his injury to heal.

The first celebrity forced to pull out of the competition was Made in Chelsea star Jamie Laing, who injured himself before the competition even began.

Jamie landed awkwardly during the red carpet launch, consequently hurting his leg.

He was replaced by Emmerdale star Kelvin Fletcher, who was paired with Oti Mabuse and looks set to make it through to the latest stages of the contest.

Strictly Come Dancing ’s executive producer Sarah James said: “We are so sad that Will is unable to continue on the show. He is an incredible and talented person who has brought us some unforgettable moments this series - in particular his powerful and moving couples choice routine.

"He will be greatly missed and we wish him a speedy recovery.”

*Strictly Come Dancing returns next Saturday at 7pm on BBC One
description: Paralympian Will Bayley has quit Strictly Come Dancing after his 'freak injury' has failed to recover
